newsitem.title: BELGIUM: AEA airlines cargo up 7pct in August.
newsitem.headline: AEA airlines cargo up 7pct in August.

text.p: Global freight traffic carried by West European airlines in August 1996 was up seven percent on the same month last year at 1.87 billion freight tonne-kilometres, FTK, the Association of European Airlines (AEA) said.
The FTK measurement is derived by multiplying the weight of cargo carried by the distance flown.

Commenting on the figures the AEA said: "In August, the Far East/Australasia sector consolidated its lead over the North Atlantic sector as European airlines' premier cargo market in terms of tonnes-kilometres generated."
722.3 million FTK was transported on Europe-Far East/Australasia routes, an increase of 9.5 percent on August 1995.
663.3 million FTK were flown on Europe-North America air cargo routes, up 3.5 percent on 1995 levels, AEA added.
Airfreight transported by AEA member airlines, by geographical region, in August 1996, with percentage change on August 1995, was as follows:
